pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #15482
[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
‚ö†Ô∏è The sha of the head commit of this PR conflicts with #15482. Mergify cannot evaluate rules on this PR. ‚ö†Ô∏è
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/0117233a-24ca-449d-84a3-e98924e58227) for commit b292044ba2b12b7f10f5d45891e086a8b1079d96.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/18f1d4b2-7cc5-4cb8-9ba0-f710b007f6b2/to/0117233a-24ca-449d-84a3-e98924e58227) against commit 10a631f1d3d9d99b990791ca0a251a5e78a15d84:
```diff
  Benchmark                         Metric         Change
  =======================================================
+ ~Mathlib.GroupTheory.CosetCover   instructions   -18.1%
```

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15482~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

If you want to implement #15474 (which I certainly do), you just need to remove some simp theorems that really should not be simp theorems to begin with #15591. Then other changes can be evaluated on their own.
I sent #15591 to bors.
The fixes to `to_additive` should build with master shortly then
This all seems a bit weird to me; do we even want these to be separate types in the first place? Would making `HasQuotient` and its projections reducible work instead?
Another option is to make `HasQuotient` output a `Setoid`, then take a quotient w.r.t. this setoid. I don't know what will be slow/fast, though.
#15585 #15586 I think if making `QuotientAddGroup.mk` an `abbrev`, neither method will resolve the timeout.
@mattrobball What's your opinion here?

pullRequest.title: chore(GroupTheory/Coset): reduce defeq abuse

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: make `to_additive` deal with `abbrev` correctly
